content: Hello everyone! First time i join zulip but i've been wanting to contribute to rust compiler/stdlib for a while now and did not know where to start so i asked @Steve Klabnik and he told me that joining the chat might be a good starting point :) I've (partially) read the dev guide and be happy to be mentored on an actual issue! I am eager to learn to stuff!

Hi @marmeladema! You may want to take a look at issues labeled E-mentor. Is there any particular area you are most interested in? Do you want to work on documentation, type checking, codegen, improving errors or something else?

So I looked multiple times at E-mentor, E-easy or E-medium, but each time, someone had already started working on it or ticket is out of date, so i kind of jump to something else. I love writing rust code, so anything to get more familiar with the code base would be good. Hidden agenda is at some point, helping out on some features like https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/44265 (generic associated types / GAT)
If you want to help out on GATs, then maybe https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144729-wg-traits is for you :slight_smile:
